title: Omnis\Sigma KServer errors
Clearing Omnis Locking Issues
text: In the first instance ask all users to exit the Omnis system. Log in to Omnis as the SUPER user. Run Utilities>Supervisor Functions>Display ALL Update Flags If any of the options have users displayed in the Status run Utilities>Supervisor Functions>Clear ALL Update Flags and enter Y to Clear:- Select Yes to Save this data? While users are out of the system run Clear ALL Report Files Run Start>Micross Omnis>System Activity Display:- If this is not available it needs to be installed. See Separate Knowledgebase Article. Run the Omnis System Activity software:- If this Displays and Entity or File Locks run Action>Delete All Locks:- If you are unable to install the Omnis System Activity, you can clear the entity locks by navigating to the Omnis Control directory and deleting the MILOCK.DAT file. Omnis will create a new one when logging into Omnis. Log into the KServer pc and open Computer Management>Services and stop the K3 OmnisSigma Server service:- Check the Task Manager and end task and open NTVDM.EXE files Start the K3 OmnisSigma Server service:- Log onto the Omnis Server and run Computer Management>Shared Folders>Open Files:- Highlight any Omnis files and Close Open File:- .
description:
In the first instance ask all users to exit the Omnis system.


Log in to Omnis as the SUPER user.


Run Utilities>Supervisor Functions>Display ALL Update Flags



If any of the options have users displayed in the Status run Utilities>Supervisor Functions>Clear ALL Update Flags and enter Y to Clear:-



Select Yes to Save this data?


While users are out of the system run Clear ALL Report Files



Run Start>Micross Omnis>System Activity Display:-



If this is not available it needs to be installed. See Separate Knowledgebase Article.


Run the Omnis System Activity software:-


If this Displays and Entity or File Locks run Action>Delete All Locks:-



If you are unable to install the Omnis System Activity, you can clear the entity locks by navigating to the Omnis Control directory and deleting the MILOCK.DAT file. Omnis will create a new one when logging into Omnis.


Log into the KServer pc and open Computer Management>Services and stop the K3 OmnisSigma Server service:-




Check the Task Manager and end task and open NTVDM.EXE files



Start the K3 OmnisSigma Server service:- 



Log onto the Omnis Server and run Computer Management>Shared Folders>Open Files:-



Highlight any Omnis files and Close Open File:-




.

title: Installing the Omnis Activity Display software
text: The Omnis Activity Display needs to be installed on the Omnis Client. The software for the Omnis Activity Display is located in the root of the Omnis media:- Locate the folder and run the Setup.exe Enter Yes at the following screen:- Click Next:- Select Yes:- Select Next:- Select Next:- Select Next:- Select Finish:- Select This program installed correctly if the following screen displays:- Run Start>Micross Omnis>System Activity Display:-
description:
The Omnis Activity Display needs to be installed on the Omnis Client.


The software for the Omnis Activity Display is located in the root of the Omnis media:-



Locate the folder and run the Setup.exe



Enter Yes at the following screen:-



Click Next:-


Select Yes:-



Select Next:-



Select Next:-



Select Next:-



Select Finish:-



Select This program installed correctly if the following screen displays:-



Run Start>Micross Omnis>System Activity Display:-

title: Emergency Password
text: There is a function to create an Emergency password for Omnis\Sigma for any user set up in the system. This can be used if you need to connect on and log into Omnis\Sigma and you do not know the customers SUPER password. You might require it if a Omnis\Sigma user has forgotten their password. It is located on K3DEV-WAL0002 Enter todays date to generate todays Emergency Password:-
description:
There is a function to create an Emergency password for Omnis\Sigma for any user set up in the system.


This can be used if you need to connect on and log into Omnis\Sigma and you do not know the customers SUPER password. You might require it if a Omnis\Sigma user has forgotten their password.


It is located on K3DEV-WAL0002



Enter todays date to generate todays Emergency Password:-

title: Generating an Omnis key
text: To generate a Omnis key you need to open the Key Generator program which is located on the K3 Walton Tenant on VPC K3DEV-WAL0002 in RD Web Access (k3dev.cloud) :- Open the Contracts option in Freshdesk and Search for the customer and select them from the list:- Click Edit and copy the current key:- Copy the key into the Omnis key Generator and click Verify:- Amend the Expiry date to the new date and click Generate:- Click Verify to double check the key has the new date:- Update Freshdesk with the new key and Save:-
description:
To generate a Omnis key you need to open the Key Generator program which is located on the K3 Walton Tenant on VPC K3DEV-WAL0002 in RD Web Access (k3dev.cloud) :-


Open the Contracts option in  Freshdesk and Search for the customer and select them from the list:-



Click Edit and copy the current key:-

Copy the key into the Omnis key Generator and click Verify:-



Amend the Expiry date to the new date and click Generate:-


Click Verify to double check the key has the new date:-



Update Freshdesk with the new key and Save:-

title: Re-create a batch in Omnis SOP
Installation of a Micross Control File
Omnis with Sigma Financials Network Client Installation
text: To install the Omnis with Sigma Financials Network Client software on a pc before you begin you need to ensure that the required drives are mapped in Windows Explorer and a Command Prompt run as admin. You can find the required drive letters by opening Windows Explorer and navigating to the Omnis\Control Directory on the Omnis Server and opening MIDATPTH.TXT file:- Open Windows Explorer and navigate to the Omnis\Control\Client directory and run the Setup.exe
description:
To install the Omnis with Sigma Financials Network Client software on a pc before you begin you need to ensure that the required drives are mapped in Windows Explorer and a Command Prompt run as admin.


You can find the required drive letters by opening Windows Explorer and navigating to the Omnis\Control Directory on the Omnis Server and opening MIDATPTH.TXT file:-






Open Windows Explorer and navigate to the Omnis\Control\Client directory and run the Setup.exe

title: Omnis with Sigma Financials Server and Client Upgrade
text: Before starting an upgrade, connect onto a pc with the Omnis Client installed and log into Omnis as the SUPER and check all users are out of the system and switch on the deny log on flag in Tools>Options: - Check the drive mappings as follows: Review Utilities > Supervisor Functions > Set Up Environment to obtain existing values. Transfer the Omnis media to the K3 Media folder on the Omnis server. If the K3 Media folder does not exist create one under the K3BTG folder. Create a folder under the K3BTG if one does not already exist and backup the OMNIS and SIGMA folders. If Open Database is used, RDP to the pc and pause it. If KServer is installed, connect onto it via RDC and stop the service. To do this, on the machine which has the KServer installed, click on the start icon, right click on Computer, and click on Manage. Then click on Services, right click on the K3OmnisSigmaServer service, and select Stop. On the Omnis Server map the required drives in CMD (Command Prompt) run as administrator. Enter CMD into the run field and right click Command Prompt and select Run as administrator: - Click Yes at this message: - Enter NET USE to check if the drives are mapped: - If there are no entries map the required drives: - Type NET USE to check the drives have mapped as expected: - Upgrade Network Server Navigate to the K3 Media folder and run the setup.exe from the root of the OmnisV9.924 folder: - Choose the 'Network Server' option. Select Browse and navigate to the Control directory: - This will then run through the install, click Finish when it has completed. Run the Install Elite This must be run from a 32-bit machine. Navigate to the Omnis\Control directory and open MIDATPTH.TXT. Run Command Prompt as Administrator Type Net use and enter the path as per the MIDATPTH.TXT file as shown in the example below: - From the Control directory enter INSTALL Install Network Client To run the Omnis client installation open Windows Explorer and navigate to the Omnis client directory on the Omnis Server: - This will then run the install/upgrade. Note: The error message below relates to earlier operating systems – this is safe to ignore if it come up in the display: - At the next screen select "Do not make any changes." (this file does not exist in Windows 10 and 11 64-bit o/s) The Client install/upgrade is now complete. Run Omnis on client: If the KServer is installed, the service should have been stopped and therefore must now be restarted. To do this, on the machine which has the KServer installed, click on the start icon, right click on Computer, and click on Manage. Then click on Services, right click on the K3OmnisSigmaServer service, and select Start>Run Omnis from the desktop icon. You may be requested to enter the licence key details. Click OK. Any drive inconsistencies will be flagged at this stage. If so, Identify & correct any drive errors found by the procedure (shown in red) …. Login in as SUPER with the emergency password of the day. The updated versions of Omnis and/or Sigma will now be available to use. Advise the customer to: Update the other clients. If open database is used, start it. Recover bespoke reports. (a copy will be in the Omnis\Control\Reports directory you backup at the start.) If necessary, change the flag in Omnis to allow users to log in.
description:
Before starting an upgrade, connect onto a pc with the Omnis Client installed and log into Omnis as the SUPER and check all users are out of the system and switch on the deny log on flag in Tools>Options: -

 

 

 

Check the drive mappings as follows:

Review Utilities > Supervisor Functions > Set Up Environment to obtain existing values.

 

Transfer the Omnis media to the K3 Media folder on the Omnis server. If the K3 Media folder does not exist create one under the K3BTG folder.

 

Create a folder under the K3BTG if one does not already exist and backup the OMNIS and SIGMA folders.

 

If Open Database is used, RDP to the pc and pause it.

If KServer is installed, connect onto it via RDC and stop the service. To do this, on the machine which has the KServer installed, click on the start icon, right click on Computer, and click on Manage. Then click on Services, right click on the K3OmnisSigmaServer service, and select Stop.

On the Omnis Server map the required drives in CMD (Command Prompt) run as administrator.

 

Enter CMD into the run field and right click Command Prompt and select Run as administrator: -

 

 

Click Yes at this message: -

Enter NET USE to check if the drives are mapped: -

 

 

If there are no entries map the required drives: -

 

 

 

Type NET USE to check the drives have mapped as expected: -

 

Upgrade Network Server

 

Navigate to the K3 Media folder and run the setup.exe from the root of the OmnisV9.924 folder: -

 

 

 

 

Choose the 'Network Server' option.

 

 

 

Select Browse and navigate to the Control directory: -

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This will then run through the install, click Finish when it has completed.

  

Run the Install Elite

 

This must be run from a 32-bit machine.

Navigate to the Omnis\Control directory and open MIDATPTH.TXT.

 

 

 

 

 

Run Command Prompt as Administrator

 

 

Type Net use and enter the path as per the MIDATPTH.TXT file as shown in the example below: -

 

 

From the Control directory enter INSTALL

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

Install Network Client

 

To run the Omnis client installation open Windows Explorer and navigate to the Omnis client directory on the Omnis Server: -

 

  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This will then run the install/upgrade.

 

Note:  The error message below relates to earlier operating systems – this is safe to ignore if it come up in the display: -

 

At the next screen select "Do not make any changes." (this file does not exist in Windows 10 and 11 64-bit o/s)

  

 

The Client install/upgrade is now complete.

 

 

Run Omnis on client:

 

If the KServer is installed, the service should have been stopped and therefore must now be restarted. To do this, on the machine which has the KServer installed, click on the start icon, right click on Computer, and click on Manage. Then click on Services, right click on the K3OmnisSigmaServer service, and select Start>Run Omnis from the desktop icon. You may be requested to enter the licence key details.

 

Click OK.

 

Any drive inconsistencies will be flagged at this stage.

 

If so, Identify & correct any drive errors found by the procedure (shown in red) ….

 

Login in as SUPER with the emergency password of the day.

 

The updated versions of Omnis and/or Sigma will now be available to use.

 

Advise the customer to:

Update the other clients.

If open database is used, start it.

Recover bespoke reports. (a copy will be in the Omnis\Control\Reports directory you backup at the start.)

If necessary, change the flag in Omnis to allow users to log in.

title: KServer Internal Installation Notes
text: KServer Internal Installation Notes Before the installation date advise the customer of the following prerequisites: - 1. The KServer machine must be 32-bit machine and must be a dedicated machine. 2. The KServer machine must have a static IP address. To verify this, run a DOS prompt as administrator and type: IPCONFIG /ALL If this shows DHCP Enabled = Yes, this this means it is NOT a static IP address. 3. A new Active Directory user needs to be created which will be used to run the service. It needs local admin rights. To check, go to Computer, Manage, System Tools, Local Users and Groups, Groups, Administrators. This is not relevant for a second KServer as it will have been setup when the first KServer was installed. 4. The firewall on the KServer machine must be told to allow incoming connections to KServer, both to the program and to port 7000. If the firewall is not set the 64-bit pcs will get the following message when attempting to connect to the KServer pc: - You can also get this error if the KServer service is not started. If you have adequate rights this can be added from Control Panel, search for Windows Firewall and select option: - Advanced settings>Inbound Rules>New Rule… On the day of the installation Anywhere in these instructions where a DOS prompt is required, if the KServer machine has an operating system that has user access control, i.e. anything from Vista onwards, then the dos prompt should be run as Administrator (by right-clicking on the menu action and choosing ‘run as administrator’). Need to establish the version of Omnis. 9.3nn is the earliest version which contains the Omnis.ocx, Sigma.ocx and Micrun.exe that are compatible with KServer. If not a compatible version, then these 3 files will have to be manually copied to the KServer and all workstations. Switch on options for running Window 10 32-bit. Log in to the KServer machine as the KServer AD user and install an Omnis/Sigma client on it. Ensure that it is working before doing anything else. If the Omnis system is less than 9.3nn, then copy the new Omnis.ocx, Sigma.ocx and Micrun.exe to the Omnis client folder on the KServer machine and run REGAPP.BAT which will be found in the same folder. This will register the new OCX files. Omnis should still work after this, so check it does. Put the files KServer.exe and K3Maps.dat in the Omnis client folder on the KServer machine. If you are setting up multiple KSERVER pc’s copy the Kserver.exe and K3Maps.txt from the original KServer pc. (If you don’t have access to the original KServer it might be possible to connect to it by opening Windows Explorer and typing the following into the address line \\IPAddress\C$ (\\192.168.243.225\C$) Open the K3Maps.dat with Notepad and add lines to it for the Omnis/Sigma data drives. For example, S: \\K3C-KarenA-XP\K3BTG Remove the sample line at the start of the file. From a DOS prompt run as Administrator, type KSERVER INSTALL. The KServer service which is called K3OmnisSigmaServer should now show as a Windows service. Assign the KServer AD user to the service (right-click properties, assign user). If this account shows as .\ is means the pc is not part of the domain. You can check this in the properties of My Computer: - The example shows the domain is k3btg.local. A pc not on the domain may just show WORKGROUP. For the service to work the pc must be added to the domain. Once added enter the account details that will run the service: - Start the KServer service from the services area in Windows or by typing KSERVER RUN in an administrator DOS prompt. Copy the file called OMNSVR.INI from the KServer master’s to the Omnis control folder on the Omnis server. Edit it with Notepad and put the IP address of the KServer machine in it. Remember this should have a fixed IP address. Install an Omnis client onto the new 64-bit machine. If multiple KServer are implemented (a maximum of 10 users per KServer pc) a registry setting will need to be added to each 64-bit pc, which will hold the Ip address of the KServer to which the users will be using. This setting will override the Ip address in the Omnissvr.ini file in the Control directory. HKEY_CURRENT-USER\Software\K3 BTG\Omnis\Settings\ServerIp Check the KServer pc does not have hibernation mode switched on.
description:
KServer Internal Installation Notes

Before the installation date advise the customer of the following prerequisites: -

 

1. The KServer machine must be 32-bit machine and must be a dedicated machine.

 

2. The KServer machine must have a static IP address.  

To verify this, run a DOS prompt as administrator and type:

IPCONFIG /ALL

If this shows DHCP Enabled = Yes, this this means it is NOT a static IP address.

 

3. A new Active Directory user needs to be created which will be used to run the service.  It needs local admin rights.   To check, go to Computer, Manage, System Tools, Local Users and Groups, Groups, Administrators. This is not relevant for a second KServer as it will have been setup when the first KServer was installed.

 

 

4. The firewall on the KServer machine must be told to allow incoming connections to KServer, both to the program and to port 7000.

 

If the firewall is not set the 64-bit pcs will get the following message when attempting to connect to the KServer pc: -

 

 

You can also get this error if the KServer service is not started.

If you have adequate rights this can be added from Control Panel, search for Windows Firewall and select option: -

Advanced settings>Inbound Rules>New Rule…

 

 

 

 

On the day of the installation 

 

Anywhere in these instructions where a DOS prompt is required, if the KServer machine has an operating system that has user access control, i.e. anything from Vista onwards, then the dos prompt should be run as Administrator (by right-clicking on the menu action and choosing ‘run as administrator’).

 

Need to establish the version of Omnis.  9.3nn is the earliest version which contains the Omnis.ocx, Sigma.ocx and Micrun.exe that are compatible with KServer.  If not a compatible version, then these 3 files will have to be manually copied to the KServer and all workstations.

 

Switch on options for running Window 10 32-bit.

 

 

Log in to the KServer machine as the KServer AD user and install an Omnis/Sigma client on it.  Ensure that it is working before doing anything else.  

  

If the Omnis system is less than 9.3nn, then copy the new Omnis.ocx, Sigma.ocx and Micrun.exe to the Omnis client folder on the KServer machine and run REGAPP.BAT which will be found in the same folder.   This will register the new OCX files.   Omnis should still work after this, so check it does.

 

Put the files KServer.exe and K3Maps.dat in the Omnis client folder on the KServer machine.  If you are setting up multiple KSERVER pc’s copy the Kserver.exe and K3Maps.txt from the original KServer pc. (If you don’t have access to the original KServer it might be possible to connect to it by opening Windows Explorer and typing the following into the address line \\IPAddress\C$ (\\192.168.243.225\C$) Open the K3Maps.dat with Notepad and add lines to it for the Omnis/Sigma data drives. For example, S: \\K3C-KarenA-XP\K3BTG  Remove the sample line at the start of the file.

 

From a DOS prompt run as Administrator, type KSERVER INSTALL.  

 

 

 

The KServer service which is called K3OmnisSigmaServer should now show as a Windows service.   

Assign the KServer AD user to the service (right-click properties, assign user). If this account shows as .\ is means the pc is not part of the domain. You can check this in the properties of My Computer: - 

The example shows the domain is k3btg.local. A pc not on the domain may just show WORKGROUP.

For the service to work the pc must be added to the domain. Once added enter the account details that will run the service: -

 

 

 

Start the KServer service from the services area in Windows or by typing KSERVER RUN in an administrator DOS prompt.

 

 

Copy the file called OMNSVR.INI from the KServer master’s to the Omnis control folder on the Omnis server.  Edit it with Notepad and put the IP address of the KServer machine in it.  Remember this should have a fixed IP address.

 

Install an Omnis client onto the new 64-bit machine.

 

If multiple KServer are implemented (a maximum of 10 users per KServer pc) a registry setting will need to be added to each 64-bit pc, which will hold the Ip address of the KServer to which the users will be using. This setting will override the Ip address in the Omnissvr.ini file in the Control directory.

 

HKEY_CURRENT-USER\Software\K3 BTG\Omnis\Settings\ServerIp

 

 

Check the KServer pc does not have hibernation mode switched on.

title: Setting up a new company in Omnis using Company Selector.
text: Setting up a new company in Omnis using Company Selector Create a folder with the new Company name and copy the Omnis structure underneath. In Windows Explorer navigate to the new Omnis\Control directory and open MIDATPTH.TXT Amend the MIDATPTH.TXT file and update with the new Company folder name: - Open CMD as administrator and enter net use and check the drives are mapped: - Enter the Change Drive paths for all those listed in the MIDATPTH.TXT: - Check each CD mapping: - From the Control drive enter MIVDUSET on the new Control folder created for the new company and check the drives and amend if necessary: - Go into P, M and E check that each has the correct drive letter: - Click OK and then press Escape and this will take the CMD back to the Control path: - Copy the Company’s Micross file into the new Control directory: – Enter maint4 micross and press enter: - Enter 3. Amend a record: - Enter record number = 1, first byte = 104, type = a (ascii), length = 1, set the value to 0 Record number = 1, first byte = 50, type = a (ascii), length = 1, set the value to 0 Record number = 1, first byte = 50, type = a (ascii), length = 1, set the value to 0 Press enter at this screen: - Press escape at this screen: - Press escape several times to go back to the Control directory path: - Using Windows Explorer navigate to the K3 Media>OmnisV9.xxx folder and run the setup.exe: - Click Next: - Click Yes: - Select Copy Install Disk and click Next: - Browse the Destination Folder to the new Company Control Directory and click Next: - Click Finish: - Go back to the CMD and type install: - Respond to the prompts: - Next type “Milogin” and respond to the prompts, at this stage you may be required to enter the license key. Enter the SUPER log in: - Once this screen displays you can press escape back to the Control directory: - Amend OmnisCompanydata.ini file: - Run Company Selector Icon and select the new company to log into Omnis and respond to the prompts offered. Click OK to the Installation Process: - Log in: - In the Omnis menu navigate to Supervisor Functions>Support Functions>Set Up Environment and check all the drives are set up and correct: -
description:
Setting up a new company in Omnis using Company Selector

 

Create a folder with the new Company name and copy the Omnis structure underneath.

 

 

 

 

In Windows Explorer navigate to the new Omnis\Control directory and open MIDATPTH.TXT


 

 

 

 

Amend the MIDATPTH.TXT file and update with the new Company folder name: -

 

 

 

Open CMD as administrator and enter net use and check the drives are mapped: -

 

 

Enter the Change Drive paths for all those listed in the MIDATPTH.TXT: -

 

 

Check each CD mapping: -

 

 

 

From the Control drive enter MIVDUSET on the new Control folder created for the new company and check the drives and amend if necessary: - 

 

 

 

Go into P, M and E check that each has the correct drive letter: -

 

 

 

 

 

 

Click OK and then press Escape and this will take the CMD back to the Control path: -

 

 

Copy the Company’s Micross file into the new Control directory: – 

 

 

 

Enter maint4 micross and press enter: -




Enter 3.  Amend a record: -


 

 

Enter record number = 1, first byte = 104, type = a (ascii), length = 1, set the value to 0



Record number = 1, first byte = 50, type = a (ascii), length = 1, set the value to 0

 

 

 

 

Record number = 1, first byte = 50, type = a (ascii), length = 1, set the value to 0

 


Press enter at this screen: - 

 

 

Press escape at this screen: -


 

Press escape several times to go back to the Control directory path: -

 

 

Using Windows Explorer navigate to the K3 Media>OmnisV9.xxx folder and run the setup.exe: - 

 

 

Click Next: -


 

Click Yes: -



Select Copy Install Disk and click Next: -


 

Browse the Destination Folder to the new Company Control Directory and click Next: -


Click Finish: - 


Go back to the CMD and type install: -



Respond to the prompts: -



Next type “Milogin” and respond to the prompts, at this stage you may be required to enter the license key.




Enter the SUPER log in: -

 

 

 

 


Once this screen displays you can press escape back to the Control directory: -

 


Amend OmnisCompanydata.ini file: -


 

 

Run Company Selector Icon and select the new company to log into Omnis and respond to the prompts offered.


 


Click OK to the Installation Process: -



Log in: -




In the Omnis menu navigate to Supervisor Functions>Support Functions>Set Up Environment and check all the drives are set up and correct: -
